title: Market & Bazaar Vocabulary
description: Explore the colorful vocabulary of markets, bazaars, and trading culture from around the world

questions.question: What does the word 'bazaar' originally mean?
options: A marketplace or covered market, derived from Persian

questions.question: In market terminology, what does 'haggling' refer to?
options: Negotiating the price of goods through back-and-forth discussion between buyer and seller

questions.question: What is a 'souk' in Middle Eastern culture?
options: An open-air marketplace or commercial quarter found in Middle Eastern and North African cities

questions.question: In market vocabulary, what is a 'vendor'?
options: A person or business that sells goods, especially at a market stall or stand

questions.question: What does 'artisan' mean in the context of markets?
options: A skilled craftsperson who makes products by hand using traditional methods

questions.question: In market culture, what is a 'flea market'?
options: An informal market selling secondhand goods, antiques, and curiosities at low prices

questions.question: What is a 'mercado' in Spanish-speaking countries?
options: A market or marketplace, often a vibrant center for fresh food and local goods

questions.question: In market terminology, what does 'barter' mean?
options: Exchanging goods or services directly without using money

questions.question: What is a 'floating market' in Southeast Asian culture?
options: A market on an upper floor
A market where vendors sell goods from boats on waterways

questions.question: In market vocabulary, what does 'wholesale' mean?
options: Selling goods in large quantities at lower prices, typically to retailers

questions.question: What is a 'night market' in Asian culture?
options: An open-air market that operates in the evening, featuring street food, shopping, and entertainment

questions.question: In market terminology, what is a 'farmers market'?
options: A market that only farmers can visit
A market where local farmers and producers sell fresh produce and goods directly to consumers

questions.question: What does 'fair trade' mean in market culture?
options: A movement ensuring producers in developing countries receive fair prices and work under decent conditions

questions.question: In market vocabulary, what is a 'hawker'?
options: A person who sells goods by calling out in public places or going door to door

questions.question: What is a 'Grand Bazaar' like the one in Istanbul?
options: One of the world's oldest and largest covered markets, with thousands of shops in a labyrinth of streets
